tweets.text: Cutbacks stopping vital work on river pollution and floods in England. Great to see @RiverActionUK pushing for urgent action & funding. #EndSewagePollution @rivercide_live @amyslack84 @watsonchas https://t.co/h2Gnt3W6ZA

@annjsmall @tayz_BETH @ClareDinnisEA @MPGeorgeEustice @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @WalleysQ @StinkStopthe I think the trouble is that fishing licence evasion is easy-pickings, so doesn't cost much to enforce. Picking a fight with a waste management company that will throw over a million quid at a legal defence is a whole different ball game.

@ProjectBoat1 @TW11Harbour @_SandraWindsor @SimonShep64 @EnvAgency @EnvAgencySE @MarkHill03 @CRTSouthEast @RichardShead The EA only 're-profiles' the the river bed in the fairway as it's required to do. The spoil is dumped in scour holes upstream to protect the invertebrates. The dredging word was banned from use for years after the dredgers were sold off.

So @EmmaHowardBoyd wrote to Env Minister George Eustice to explain that the huge funding cuts to @EnvAgency have reduced the agency‚Äôs capacity to respond to pollution events!

Bravo @RiverActionUK @watsonchas for uncovering this correspondence.

https://t.co/jfRKGew4Rs

Anyone else hear about guy from Hereford who picked up a nasty infection swimming in the Wye last wkend? A couple of canoeists have been really ill too. People are getting scared. Who is responsible for advising of hazards? @BritishCanoeing @EnvAgency @WUFoundation @guyadams https://t.co/uwixkFPdsJ

Brilliant work@VeoliaUK you have just succeeded in alienating most of the Birders in the UK with the senceless destruction of the grassland habitat and associated biodiversity especially nestlings of redlist birds totally senseless! https://t.co/qPJqXK5V8k
